summary: This is an email chain from July 2020 between FBI personnel and a US Attorney's Office contractor regarding discrepancies in a spreadsheet tracking electronic devices seized from Jeffrey Epstein's New York residence. The discussion focuses on reconciling device inventory numbers and confirming the status of forensic extractions.

persons.name: S. Watson
persons.context: FBI agent copied on the email chain regarding the device inventory spreadsheet.

connections.description: Both are FBI personnel copied on the same email chain concerning forensic evidence in the Epstein case.

events.title: Spreadsheet Discrepancy Review
events.description: Email correspondence reveals ongoing efforts to reconcile a spreadsheet inventory of electronic devices seized from Epstein's NY residence, identifying missing and incorrectly listed items.

events.title: Initial Spreadsheet Submission
events.description: An FBI examiner sent an initial spreadsheet of seized electronic devices to the US Attorney's Office, noting most items were already at the Southern District.

locations: HQ (likely FBI headquarters or field office)
Southern (likely Southern District of New York)
keyFacts: The FBI was actively inventorying and forensically processing a significant number of electronic devices (iPhones, iMacs, laptops, desktops) seized from Jeffrey Epstein's New York residence as of July 2020.
A spreadsheet tracking these devices contained discrepancies, including a missing 'space grey iMac' (NYC024328) and questions about the status of other devices.
At least one iPhone 5 was still being unlocked at FBI headquarters at the time of this correspondence.
The communication is subject to a protective order, indicating the sensitive nature of the evidence and investigation.
